text: The many royals of Kensington Palace, and where they live. The arrows points towards Buckingham Palace, where Queen Elizabeth and Prince Philip live. Samantha Lee / Business Insider With a royal birth, a royal wedding, and another royal wedding to come, 2018 is shaping up to be a year of massive change for Britain's royal family. And the royal property that's ringing in the changes more than any other is undoubtedly the historic Kensington Palace in London, which is now home to 15 members of the royal family, spanning three generations. The palace, a royal residence since the 1600s, has taken on three new arrivals this spring, making it easily the most bustling of the royal family's many grand homes. A view of Kensington Palace, featuring a statue of its first royal inhabitant, William III. Getty Images
